overview_of_class: This course focuses on the psychological understanding of evil. Beginning from a definitional perspective on evil, the course moves to theories of evil. The core of the course is explanation of Philip Zimbardo's Stanford Prison Experiment in its original form with a current critique by Zimbardo of his findings in the original experiment. From this basis the psychological dimensions of evil are developed, leading to a description of major explanations of the reality of evil. Special attention will be paid to an understanding of evil as this area relates to the lives of members of the class. Carries social science credit.
name: Topics in Psychology
subject: PSYCH
